channel.title: Need full "parseIncomingPackets()" void [317]
channel.description:
Does anyone have a complete parseIncomingPackets() void?
Client I am using is bluur based (not sure if packets vary between clients)
I'm mainly interested in the following packets: 35, 57 & 181 so if you have any code for those 3 please post :D
EDIT: I have found out the payload for the item used in Packet 57 (thanks to this http://pastebin.com/f5a011ee2) still needing help on the rest and the npc payload from 57

            {

                int k11 = inStream.readUnsignedByte();
                int j17 = inStream.readUnsignedByte();
                int k21 = inStream.readUnsignedByte();

                anIntArray873[l3] = k11;
                anIntArray1203[l3] = j17;
                anIntArray928[l3] = k21;
                anIntArray1030[l3] = 0;
                pktType = -1;
                return true;

Packet documentation.

It should be quite obvious when you find the packet structure too.

item.title: Need full "parseIncomingPackets()" void [317]
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Packet 35 - Use magic on an object.
Packet 181 - Use magic on ground item.

I don’t know the payloads, though.

I came up with this for the packet i’m looking for…
